item.description:
Since the Feb 6th hike seemed to be a hit I thought I'd set-up another one.

Parking for the trailhead is at the end of Hickory Hill Road. Walk straight ahead and you'll come to some powerlines and then the Musquash Conservation entrance is right there... The hike can be 45 minutes to more than 2 hours, depending on how far the group wants to go.

I find wearing my Stabilicers (like Yax Trax) helpful for the icy patches.... but others did fine with just winter boots...
item.how_to_find_us: Park at the end of Hickory Hill Drive and heading straight to the trails we can meet under the power lines. I'll be wearing a black bandana with my hair in pony tails.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Londonderry Musquash Conservation
